intro: Senecio palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to dry conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Senecio palmeri is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
